- [x] (1) Order of properties sometimes is not applied.

Orienteer-Architect doesn't apply order of properties

issues.body:
Lets imagine the following model:

```
class Folder
property name
property files (LINKLIST to documents of class File) visualization is 'table'

class File
property name
property folder (LINK to document of class Folder)
```

If you open page `/browse/File`: there are sorting and filtering. But if you go to some Folder and see table of files: there are no filtering. Please add.
issues.title: Filtering doesn't work for LINKLIST/LINKSET generated tables

issues.body: Dates are mismatch during VIEW and EDIT modes
issues.title: Modification of Date/Time properties doesn't work as expected

issues.body:
When user don't have permission for some action "access denied" message creates on page but then page reloads and I can't see this message.
I test it in 'orienteer-architect' when create class by user that don't have permission for create class (user don't have permission UPDATE in database.cluster.internal)
issues.title: Bug with "access denied" feedback message

issues.body:
When use two slash in URL I give too many errors in respond from server.
**Steps for reproduce:**
In URL write {orienteer.doman}// (use two slash at the end). Example: localhost:8080//
**Result:**
![2017-08-19 13-56-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20383875/29486067-3bb8b2b4-84e6-11e7-8dd7-10d373f667fc.png)
![2017-08-19 13-57-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20383875/29486074-61581762-84e6-11e7-89b3-21cd66e3e5c6.png)
issues.title: Errors when use two slash in URL

issues.body:
and probably images. If you will check page sources: SVG referenced to /tmp directory instead of http.

Might be this will help: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11576157/birt-how-to-make-embedded-image-chart-in-html-report
So: if image needs to be displayed - it can be registered as wicket dynamic resource.

2. Create ClassB
3. Create LINKMAP property on ClassA linked to ClassB
4. Create an instance of ClassA

**ER:** LINKMAP property should be visualized as key-value pairs, where value could be selected only from linked class (ClassB in this example)
**AR:** LINKMAP property visualized as simple text field (with error on Save action)

3. Fill DATE type property
4. Save document
5. Refresh webpage

issues.title: UI Readonly doesn't work for 'table' visualization
issues.body:
1. Create ClassAlice
2. Create ClassBob
3. Create ClassAlice.linklistToBob LINKLIST with 'table' visualization, reverse, UI READONLY
4. Create ClassBob.linkToAlice LINK with 'listbox' visualization, reverse
5. Create some documents of ClassAlice
6. Create document of ClassBob, set reference to any ClassAlice
7. Go to linked ClassAlice fullview

ER: ClassBob is showed in table widget, control menu buttons not available
AR: Control menu is available, it is possible to edit ClassBob documents from ClassAlice

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fix of NPE in calculated docs widget: fix #425

issues.title: If results for Calculated Widget is empty: there is exception

issues.body:
Repro
1 By default, a property is displayed on the tab Parameters. I cannot specify the order of this tab relative to others.
2 If I specity for a property that it should be destpayed on a tab Parameters, the document will show two tabs with similar name "Parameters".

Suggestion
If we make the default value Tab:Parameters and make it obligatory, both issues from Repro wll be fixed.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17749672/16178285/4c92007a-364c-11e6-9bf3-e50a293a671e.png)
issues.title: Tab ordering in a document

issues.body:
Lets imaging the following schema:

```
Class A
   Property A  - defined as name property of documents of Class A

Class B extends Class A
   Property A - inherited from Class A
   Property B - and it's set up as overriding document name property
```

Current behavior:

If user go to /browse/A he will see every document listed here: which has either class A or class B. First column will be defined as Property A, but for documents of class B it will show actually value of Property B.

Expected behavior:

If listing for parent class (Class A in our case) first column should have that property from all documents: disregard of their actual class.

P.S. Expected behavior also seems a little bit strange. Probably some better solution might come up.
issues.title: Entity column should stick to specific property

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Make widget css first to remove some glitches: partial fix of #340

Make rendering faster by allowing to apply CSS for widgets before JS

Fix #340

issues.title: Make rendering on fast internet smooth
issues.body:
On fast internet and server it's quite annouing to see glitching rendering of a page between requests.
It might happen because CSS and JS are in mixed order. To be OK we need to have CSS first and then JS.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Perspective items urls should be context relative. Issue #171

issues.title: Absolute wicket pathes don't work if deployment URL contains a path
issues.body: By default I'm deploying to `localhost:8080/orienteer-war` which breaks most of the `@MountPath` wicket annotations (e.g. `ListOClassesPage` is annotated with `@MountPath("/classes")`) and causes resources to be unavailable on the server.
Some pages of the demo show some internationalization issues, e.g. http://demo.orienteer.org/property/Clazz/prop contains both english language and word sin cyrillic characters.
issues.title: Fix internationalization

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fix archetype startup properties loading. Issue #169

issues.title: AssertionError in in orienteer-archetype-war
issues.body:
During `mvn clean install` the following AssertionError occurs

```
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test set: org.orienteer.archetype.simpletest.TestMyWebApplication
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 545.754 sec <<< FAILURE!
testWebApplicationClass(org.orienteer.archetype.simpletest.TestMyWebApplication)  Time elapsed: 0.036 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError
    at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
    at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
    at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:52)
    at org.orienteer.archetype.simpletest.TestMyWebApplication.testWebApplicationClass(TestMyWebApplication.java:25)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
    at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:47)
    at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
    at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:44)
    at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.InvokeMethod.evaluate(InvokeMethod.java:17)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.runLeaf(ParentRunner.java:271)
    at org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.runChild(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.java:70)
    at org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.runChild(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.java:50)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$3.run(ParentRunner.java:238)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$1.schedule(ParentRunner.java:63)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.runChildren(ParentRunner.java:236)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.access$000(ParentRunner.java:53)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner$2.evaluate(ParentRunner.java:229)
    at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.run(ParentRunner.java:309)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4.JUnit4TestSet.execute(JUnit4TestSet.java:53)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4.JUnit4Provider.executeTestSet(JUnit4Provider.java:123)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4.JUnit4Provider.invoke(JUnit4Provider.java:104)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.util.ReflectionUtils.invokeMethodWithArray(ReflectionUtils.java:164)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.ProviderFactory$ProviderProxy.invoke(ProviderFactory.java:110)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.SurefireStarter.invokeProvider(SurefireStarter.java:175)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.SurefireStarter.runSuitesInProcessWhenForked(SurefireStarter.java:107)
    at org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.ForkedBooter.main(ForkedBooter.java:68)
```

in `testWebApplicationClass(org.orienteer.archetype.simpletest.TestMyWebApplication`.

The issue doesn't occur with PR #165, but with your partially applied version.
Example: WSource on demo site.

issues.title: Saving a new class fails with error "User 'writer' has no the permission to execute the operation 'Update' against the resource:"
issues.body:
Saving a new class fails with `User 'writer' has no the permission to execute the operation 'Update' against the resource: ResourceGeneric [name=CLUSTER, legacyName=database.cluster].internal`. See screenshots for details.

![orienteer_demo_not_writable-0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4369372/6866099/fe67b2f8-d474-11e4-9be5-7b9f62440cec.png)

commitsDetails.commitMessage: References Hook should work deeper. Issue #118

issues.title: ReferencesConsistencyHook should support deep changes
issues.body:
Case

```
ClassA
    propertyA  LINKLIST

ClassB
   propertyB.LINK

propertyA and propertyB are linked

3 instantances:

Object 1) ClassA   propertyA points to Object 2
Object 2) ClassB   propertyB points to Object 1
Object 3) Class A

And now we are changing popertyA of object 3 to point to Object 2.

Expected: property A of Object 1 should be empty
Actuall result: property A of object 1 is the same

```

commitsDetails.commitMessage: More smart types listbox population: issue #81

issues.title: Property type listbox should be populated smarter
issues.body:
Only compatible types should be there
Plus sort types alphabeticly

When super classes are selected for a class some properties of oclass might be obtained from parent classes.
Keep in mind that super classes then can be cleaned: and actually this parameters should be updated accordingly.
